channel.title: When running client i get this error
channel.description: No error now, but when i run it my autocache download won't unpack the folders in in my cache, but it will unpack all the files? any help?

item.title: When running client i get this error
item.dc:creator: @NRR NRR
item.description:
@NRR wrote:

okay i got the dropbox link to a directlink, it downloads the cache all the way and i get the cannot find path specified error and then it restarts downloading the cache again.

Read full topic

item.title: When running client i get this error
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

Dropbox and only dropbox works.
All you have to do is, when you get the link for your Cache you’ve uploaded turn it into something like this.
https://dl.dropboxusercontent… Then the rest of your link, just edit the beginning, this auto-DL’s it.
Trust me, if you upload it to dropbox, paste the link here if you don’t understand what I mean and ill be glad to help you out or just PM me.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Hyperon wrote:

So if you unzip the file manually it works yes? Find and follow an auto cache downloader tutorial it will have an unzipping section. Pictures and code help immensely. And sorry I won’t connect to your screen because I don’t have the time as everyone wants it. Nothing personal.

item.title: When running client i get this error
item.dc:creator: @NRR NRR
item.description:
@NRR wrote:

Read Error: c:/nrrcache_32/Anim/1899.dat
c:\nrrcache_32\cacheVers2.dat
java.io.FileNotFoundException: c:\nrrcache_32\Sprites\BUTTON_SOUND_0.png (The sy
stem cannot find the path specified)
at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method)
at java.io.FileOutputStream.(FileOutputStream.java:213)
at java.io.FileOutputStream.(FileOutputStream.java:101)
at client.unZipFile(client.java:3718)
at client.downloadcache(client.java:3681)
at client.method67(client.java:3757)
at client.method6(client.java:7374)
at Applet_Sub1.run(Applet_Sub1.java:52)
at client.run(client.java:4908)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

anyone know what to do with this? Thanks

Read full topic
item.source: When running client i get this error

item.title: When running client i get this error
item.dc:creator: @NRR NRR
item.description:
@NRR wrote:

dropbox doesn’t work for me, when i use uppit, i got to download link, and where it says download i right click that link and copy address, and when i enter it in my address bar and hit enter it auto downloads. I think i know the problem, though. After i let the client download the cache all the way and then get that error i go to my C: drive and click on my cache folder that it downloaded. But it didn’t unzip the file that it needs to, do you know how to fix that?

Read full topic

item.title: When running client i get this error
item.dc:creator: @NRR NRR
item.description:
@NRR wrote:

Hyperon:

Well it can’t find your Anim folder. What size is your cache? If you say it was an auto cache downloader then it might of added the folder with no data because the link is dead.

my cache is 22.4 mb, and i’m using uppit for the link, it downloads 100% then i get an error. If you have teamviewer you could help me out, if not it’s okay i’ll figure it out sooner or later. thanks

Read full topic

String s = “C:/nrrcache_32/”;

if(file.exists() || file.mkdir())
return s;

this is signlink.java and it’s capital C:/

item.source: When running client i get this error

item.title: When running client i get this error
item.dc:creator: @Hyperon Hyperon
item.description:
@Hyperon wrote:

[quote=“NRR, post:5, topic:548275”][quote author=Hyperon link=topic=667178.msg4461740#msg4461740 date=1417888532]
There are tutorials around. You could just change the path in the signlink class from c:/cache to just ./cache and then put the cache in your client folder and it will load from there.
[/quote]

I changed it to ./nrrcache_32 and it still downloads to my c:/ and i still get the same error. Could you help me out further? Thanks[/quote]
That’s because the client is still looking if the cache exists in the c:/ drive and downloads it if it doesn’t. Change your findCacheDirectory method and change the path in your cacheDownloader class to the same.

Read full topic
